etymology.description: 臋(臀) (tún, 'buttocks') + 干(干) (gān, 'dry') as phonetic = composition of 臤
etymology.interpretation: The character 臤(xián, 'strong') incorporates the component 干(干) (gān, 'dry') for its phonetic properties while 臋(臀) provides the semantic, linking to ideas of bodily strength or robustness. It is an ancient form closely related to the character 賢(賢).
